titleStmt.title: The accuser sham'd: or, A pair of bellows to blow off that dust cast upon John Fry, a Member of Parliament, by Col: John Downs, likewise a Member of Parliament, who by the confederacy and instigation of some, charged the said John Fry of blasphemy & error to the Honorable House of Commons. Whereunto is annexed, a word to the priests, lawyers, Royalists, self-seekers, and rigid-Presbyterians. Also a brief ventilation of that chaffie and absurd opinion, of three persons or subsistences in the Godhead. / By the accused John Fry.
titleStmt.author: Fry, John, 1609-1657.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Harris, and are to be sold at his house on Addle hill,

notesStmt.note: The date in the imprint appears to be incorrect. The Thomason catalog dates this item in February 1651 and a reply "Divine Beames of Glorious Light .. 1651" is dated March 1, 1651.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
